website_summaries.verdict: We'd happily recommend the Inspire to a casual fitness enthusiast, since it's affordable, smart-looking and easy to use. But be warned that you don't get a lot by way of advanced fitness features: there's no GPS, no heart monitor, no altimeter. If you can live without these, this is a sensible money-saving option.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Gadet
customer_reviews.text: I really like the small, stylish, sleek design of the Fitbit Inspire HR. It was very easy to set up and link to my mobile phone. Being able to log daily food and drink intake helps me keep track of my calories. I really like the way this gadget tracks my sleep and lets me know how much of my sleep is light sleep and deep sleep. A great all-round product that is helping me to improve my health and fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not v accurate
customer_reviews.text: I’m really not sure about this. Last night I lay awake for three hours but it thinks I had a full night’s sleep. It doesn’t recognise the activities I do - today power yoga which was v strenuous throughout the hour bar 5 mins. It doesn’t monitor heart rate. I hadn’t realised that I would need to pay another £20 for this feature. It is better than the cheaper copies but I was expecting more. I’ll give it a few days and ask to return if it doesn’t improve.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pointless
customer_reviews.text: Initially liked the look and feel of the product. After one day of use I could see that the only useful function was the stopwatch. The step count was wildly inaccurate, and it didn't do much else. Absolutely pointless without a heart rate monitor. I have not bought a different brand of fitness tracker, at half the price, which is absolutely brilliant and records some very accurate & incredibly interesting data. It is clear that the 'named brand' is not necessarily the best.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and took around 30 minutes to do so. I find it very easy to use especially the sleep tracking and heart rate features. I also like that it can link to you phone for calls, notifications and text messages.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: only useful for stepcount
customer_reviews.text: the main problem with this device is that the Inspire features get mixed up with the Inspire HR features. The Inspire no-HR has no heart rate monitor, it does track sleep (although i couldnt get this to work) but instead of showing sleep cycles eg REM/light sleep etc it tracks asleep/awake. As I couldnt get this feature to actually work I cant comment any more on it i returned it and bought Inspire HR. there are cheaper alternatives if you want a device to just count steps
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever fitness tracker and I think it's great. I thought long about it, whether to get one or not, but decided to give it a go and I can't fault it. It is very elegant, discreet and lightweight. I don't really like wearing a watch or bracelets but this is not bothering me at all. I think, the readings (sleep, calorie burn, step count) are very accurate. Very easy to set up and use. Have recommended it to my fried and she is going to get one too. Have bought a metallic strap to wear on a night out so it doesn't look too sporty although the original black strap looks classy too.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: All round good bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying my fitbit. Does what it says it should do. Tracks my heart rate, sleep and steps accurately. Only issue I've had is a fitness class wasn't tracked brilliantly, I hadn't realised you could set aerobic exercises on track (through the app and changing the exercise settings). Hopefully that will sort my issue out. It also tracked my bodypump class well via the weights setting and successfully informed me I burnt 560 calories, exactly what the class is designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money. Decent tracker that is simple with decent support and mobile app
customer_reviews.text: So far a reliable and simple tracker. After Fitbit discontinued the One I was devastated. Then I remembered I had lost two of the One's and thought changing to a wrist tracker might be worth a try. After looking around I choose this one. I like the FB app and this tracker is a decent price. Simply functionality, I didn't want the HR tracking as I use a Polar tracker with a chest strap for that. The Inspire is working fine for me so far, I bought the slightly overpriced clip for it just in case but so far haven't found wearing it on my wrist too bad. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki2015

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy FITBIT Inspire HR
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Spent hrs trying. Eventually got hold of Fitbit who agreed to send a replacement. Received a screen only in an envelope marked refurbished.So I am Expected to assemble my (purchased as new) item. HOWEVER replaced item does not work either. Internet covered with same experience with this piece of kit so failure rate clearly too high. Do not buy this model. Am demanding refund from Amazon with all the extra hassle that entails. Whether this applies to all Fitbit models I am not prepared to risk. Massive dissappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kpeg

customer_reviews.title: Guard the screen.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to set up and use. It charges in the blink of an eye to be fair and it's pretty accurate. It does pick up the odd spurious movement as a step but hey, it's still activity. Only qualm is that the screen scratches really easily so if there's a case or screen guard then do get one.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Best Fitbit so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been let down by past fitbits (battery, setup issues) but this one hasn't failed me so far, and the design and fit is nice. Unlike the cheapo competitors the FitBit actually has decent software that shows you the sleep stages. I recently lended mine to my mother who's finding it intuitive too so we'll probably buy more for the family. Get the HR version it's only a bit more but the heart-rate tracking adds a lot more data including REM in sleep stages and graphs showing which "zone" you're in when walking/exercising. If would be even better if FitBit were more ambitious with the software - which seems to be where it was about 1-2 years ago still.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for a present two weeks ago, but so far the user is very happy with it. Both the Fitbit and the phone app are very easy to use, but also provide enough information to make it interesting and motivating. We purchased the clip holder to put this in as the wearer is a nurse and can’t have wrist straps, which works perfectly, it still counts steps correctly along with all the other tracking data. All-in-all, we are very happy with this, even the price, which to my mind is very good considering what we have gotten for our money - a newly motivated walker / jogger getting fit again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Inspire! Rubbish!
customer_reviews.text: This product is rubbish! I’ve had it 7 months and have repeatedly complained that I cannot see it in daylight therefore it is useless as a watch and step counter. I have to wear a normal watch and rely on phone app to see how many steps achieved during daylight walks! Now it rarely lets me know when I’ve reached 10,000 steps and in the evening it stops recording steps for hours on end! Aftercare is useless as all they state is “turn it off and then on again”. That appears to be their answer to all queries. They must have been aware of a design fault when they sold it to unsuspecting customers!
customer_reviews.author: Barb67

customer_reviews.title: A nice unit, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I have updated from an Altar HR, and I'm impressed with all the additional features displayed on the unit. The strap feels better, but let's hope it lasts longer than the Altar strap. Accuracy seems to be about the same as the Altar. But the charging lead is a joke! It's far too short and is supposed to be held in contact magnetically, but the magnet is far too weak to be reliable. So charging needs improvement. This means you will need to add another £5+ to the cost for a longer lead. Aesthetically, it's much better than the Alta. If it wasn't for the charging lead problem it would be worth the fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: HJL

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE HR VERSION
customer_reviews.text: I bought the HR and it worked perfectly for 4 days. Then it stopped tracking exercise. I ordered a replacement, which arrived the next day. However, the replacement did not track exercise either (right from the start). I then decided to try and get it repaired so sent it off. It came back (listed as a refurbished item from abroad) and nothing has been changed or improved. I am trying to return it, but the status on Amazon still says it's out for repair, so I haven't even got an option to send it back! And the customer service chat is an automated service which is utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Glitzy Goose

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate tracking, don't waste your money on this product!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the Charge 2 but sent this back after a day because it said I did 1300 steps overnight (while I was sleeping). I've had this for about a week and the tracking is so inaccurate - it says my heart rate gets up to 200, which I highly doubt is the case. It also says I do roughly 13,000 steps a day when I have an office job and rarely move from 8-5! This product does nothing for me and I am sending it back for a refund because I'm really dissapointed with it. Only good thing is the sleep tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to update from the zip tracker so bought this on 11 March and it was delivered on 12th. Set it up worked fine. Today i want to throw it through the window! It won't sync, i deleted it to start again and it won't set up. Not on my tablet or computer. I have contacted Fitbit and they more or less just tell you to reread what you have already tried. If there is a fault why can't they fix it. It seems to me that once they have your money they couldn't care less!
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: A Step Behind....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because Google reviews said it was fabulous, I should have read the lower star Amazon reviews. I wanted an accurate method of recording min 10,000 steps per day, this tracker is absolutely useless, it records non existent steps, I moved in bed hey presto 47 steps.... I wore another tracker at the same time as this and this fitbit recorded 2500 more steps... Ridiculous....
customer_reviews.author: Quality Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Lived up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my (adult) daughter. She is delighted with it as it does everything she hoped it would. She particularly likes the sleep feature and has found the heart rate monitor fascinating. As most Fitbit users know the accuracy of steps can be questionable. I am also a Fitbit wearer and found applauding in the theatre got me to my 10k steps and another time it was in my trouser pocket and the weekly report said that I had been cycling for 20 minutes, crazy, I don't own a bike!
customer_reviews.author: Grannyduck

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.. inaccurate steps count
customer_reviews.text: I should have done more research before buying this device. Fitbit being a renowned company among other competitors, had high Hope but the step count on this is so inaccurate.. steps were counting even when I was driving or just moving hand while sitting down. Tried everything to troubleshoot as per YouTube "expert" tutorial videos but no luck. So to relief my frustration, here to share my thoughts with other buyers and hope it catches seller attention. If you dont care about the steps counter but want to use heart rate monitor, it might work out for you...though I wouldn't recommend to my friend or family..
customer_reviews.author: Suraz

customer_reviews.title: Rarely synchs with the app, data useless
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for 9 months now and have finally given up. While it happily tracks data on the tiny screen, it can take up to 30 minutes of faffing around to try and get it to synch with the app. I've tried every solution posted online, but nothing has worked. I have to unpair every device from my bluetooth first and then reconnect to the fitbit and see if it will find it. Sometimes it does, most often it doesn't . It won't pair with other tablets . Having searched for the issue online, this is a regular complaint and I certainly wouldn't recommend the item because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Geordie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Great product, find myself wanting to move around more to get my steps up to beat the day before. The new update as now added now faces for it with is brilliant. The strap is very comfortable even when sleeping. The app is brilliant and allows you to join challenges and connect with people and groups for recipes etc. The only criticism of the app is that it won’t let you delete messages so if you receive some it ends up taking up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Perry

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit sort out incompatibility with new phones
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT but this if you intend to use the latest flagship phones as fitbit still haven't made it compatible with the Samsung s20. It's incredibly unreliable on using my phone. Will randomly work some days but not others. Some days it records sleep while other nights it doesn't and its very temprimentle when it comes to saving exercises I've also found it shows my runs with random jumps back and forth as if I've backtracked up and down roads. Support blame my phones GPS yet if I track the same run on strava the GPS recording is fine. I've stopped using this as it's to unreliable
customer_reviews.author: Hanton

customer_reviews.title: FItBits Fail
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought 2 FitBits in 18 months - both have failed to last the distance which makes them an expensive 'accessory' rather than a solid state tracker. I've just ordered a cheaper version which at a third of the price will at least enable me to potentially buy 3 for every FitBit fail that I am currently having, If FitBit can't improve the product then I'd recommend that you shouldn't bother or, if you're keen to have a proper one instead buy a Garmin and have a full spec top of the range instead - you'll still be quids in vs the flimsy unFitBit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: haven't even worn it and it registers activity
customer_reviews.text: this item has been boxed for a number of weeks and even though it hasn't tracked anything the app thinks it has, I can't sync this with anything so sits on set up all the time, what a waste of money. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Denise Hill

customer_reviews.title: Strange under the skin bruises from the fit bit inspire hr
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this. However it never seemed to keep track overly well. On occasions it would move a step even if I was standing still. Sleep tracker sometimes recorded I only got 2hours sleep rather than full 8 hours. The worst thing was however and reason I returned my Fitbit was it was incredibly uncomfortable. Caused bruising under the skin, and discomfort in my wrist even once taken off. I ended up with a weird pin prick blood spot. Haven’t worn for a 5 days and my wrist is still feeling bruised under the skin. On the whole I found the 3 weeks I used the fit bit for very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Squizely

customer_reviews.title: I am SO HAPPY WITH THIS
customer_reviews.text: I have returned 2 Inspire2s as straight out of the box they had all kinds of bugs which I won't list here, the worst being DND"do not disturb" kept randomly switching on. So I am DELIGHTED that this older model which the inspire 2 replaced is wonderful! No glitches, easy set up, good tracking on heart rate and sleep patterns sleep tracking and very clear easy to use face. I love the little button on LH side. All perfect....just when I thought Fitbit and i siamply were not meant to be. By the time you read this Fitbit may have fixed the problems with Inspire 2, but until then this is a fabulous reliable unobtrusive useful piece of kit
customer_reviews.author: J London

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Fitbit in the house
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present and my partner is really pleased. He uses it every day and tracks how much water he drinks, calories he consumes and obviously steps and sleep. I have a Fitbit Charge 3 and I envy how small this one is. The thickness is the same but it looks smaller as the curve on the watch face is very ergonomic. Now we can't complain about who slept worse than the other, as we have 'scientific' proof :) Great buy with the Black Friday discounts, so happy I bought another one for my Mum.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Inspire does not monitor your heart rate
customer_reviews.text: Had Charge 2 for a couple of years and ordered an Inspire as the strap seemed thinner. I did not realise that there was no heart monitor until I’d worn it for 24 hours and found no record of my heart rate on the app. I like to see how my heart is doing as I have a pacemaker. I have now ordered another Charge 2. This has turned out expensive! So remember HR stands for “heart rate” and the Inspire in the Co lour Sangria does not monitor your heart. I know I should have double checked but ..... 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Julia A

customer_reviews.title: Shows nothing but set up screen and battery UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: Really helpful people at Fitbit support,have said unit is defective and will be sent a replacement but of course this will take another 7 days, 5 stars for support. OK I have updated my review since replacement arrived, as I was in error with thinking I could use this with android 6 (min requirement 7). Windows 10 is also only a hit and miss affair according to support. The really annoying thing is somethings that need changing I could only do via the website not via the app as well as seeing more detail on some activities, which took a long time to work out. but overall for the price I can't complain about the tracker itself.
customer_reviews.author: flyinggate

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed and manufactured case, waers so strap cannot be attached
customer_reviews.text: The case is made from some plastic, including the points where the strap attaches. These wear, and the strap falls off, and cannot be re-attached. For me this was after 12 months. This is poor design. What watch (fitness tracker) or whatever has such a useless way to attach the strap? I would expect the strap to wear, but not the device itself. So now, I have a perfectly good device, which works (nicely)...and cannot be worn Defeats the point! It seems this is a well know issue (check the forums) but Fitbit don't seem to have done anything about fixing the design, or replacing the faulty devices
customer_reviews.author: Zax

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought a different fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this one to replace my old Alta HR. It seems accurate enough, none of these trackers are perfect. I wish I could have a different app though. So many times when the app isn’t connecting or has to be restarted - not to mention the poor interface and structure. The menu on the Inspire HR is far from well organised and I personally have difficulties scrolling through the various screens, the screen is not very responsive I think. Again and again the screen turns black while I desperately try to get to a certain screen. And the screen wake usually works when you least want it but hardly ever when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Fuhrmann

customer_reviews.title: Gives you an insensitive to keep up your fitness work.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter, she is quite happy with it, but the steps are not that good as she says that it shows steps when driving and over estimates steps. Having said that she does have the inspiration to keep up with walking etc. Overall she keeps an eye on her activities. JohnV
customer_reviews.author: John V

customer_reviews.title: Charging problem on third charge - good service
customer_reviews.text: Edit: fitbit won't charge, I tried everything in the instructions and last week it was working just fine and charging. I can't understand what's happened. Edit 2: contacted the sellers and they were extremely helpful sending me a replacement after checking that it was indeed defective. Great customer service Pre problem: It's comfortable to wear, the app is easy to use and it's pretty useful. The Inspire lacks heart monitor though unlike the hr so the sleep tracking is a little confusing tracking restlessness by movement detected.
customer_reviews.author: Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with the fitbit, it is slim on my wrist, and gives accurate readings of my sleep and steps. I was inspired after I saw my sisters. Well worth the money and quite motivational. Not being technical I do need help from my husband to understand things, but the feedback on my laptop is as useful (or not) depending if I want to use it. The best part I feel is the sleep record. I don't use all of the features as I only use what I am interested in. The only thing I have a slight issue with is the charging part as it is easy to knock and disconnect. A brilliant invention though.
customer_reviews.author: Jaydee

customer_reviews.title: Tou get back what you put in
customer_reviews.text: A purchase for my wife who isn't the best with tech. It is a great little gadget though. Like all such devices it suffers a little from mistaking movement that isn't walking for steps, but the quality of the hardware is good. The app is one of the better ones. The battery life is great. The more you invest in the device and the app regarding interaction, the more you will get out of it. Plenty of branded and after market straps available too to customize the look. Judging by other friends purchases this is probably the best in class at this price point. On balance I would happily recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: washbag warrior

customer_reviews.title: Love this, bought Inspire HR in lilac
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Very comfortable to wear, easy to use and it has definitely been very helpful in getting me moving more especially during lockdown and while working from home. The strap is soft, flexible & lightweight so you hardly know you are wearing it. I have now lost weight by eating better but being aware of how much activity I am doing is a great help. It prompts you to move every hour in the day if you haven’t moved enough & is a brilliant incentive to achieve your own personal goals each day. Buzzes to alert me to phone text messages & calls too so very handy if my phone is on silent.
customer_reviews.author: TopCat

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first fitbit less than a month ago and this is now my third watch and it adds on steps even when I'm sat down. It adds on over a thousand steps on a short walk. I looked through my orders so that I can request a return but the item has gone from my history of orders, it now only shows the first watch. I have looked for a customer service number but can't find any way of contacting Amazon, hence I am hoping that Amazon will contact me to resolve this.
customer_reviews.author: Wendylou

customer_reviews.title: Step count inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch because it is the only Fitbit with a strap that won't flare up my nickel allergy. Unfortunately I've found it isn't very accurate at counting steps. It counts every arm movement as a step. Before I've even gotten out of bed in the morning it's showing that I've supposedly done over 200 steps. I've been wearing my old Garmin Vivofit 2 tracker and the Fitbit lnspire tracker on the same wrist for comparison and the Fitbit is counting nearly 3000 more steps a day than the Garmin. The sleep tracker appears to be accurate. The app could be improved to allow the you to update more settings on the tracker
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New review after using 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This feeback in addition to our earlier review in April. My husband has been using the fitbit since April. Unfortunately we regret having bought this type of fitbit. We are thoroughly disappointed with it. It seems to be faulty. Since April we have had to re set it up several times because it does sync or does not get recognised by the fitbit app. It suddenly seems to lose some of its features . The fitbit app shows that it hasn't synced the steps since June !. It is difficult to set up basic features. It is not showing the correct time of day either. I cannot recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: ulli

customer_reviews.title: A useful tool for resting heart and sleep tracking
customer_reviews.text: I got this as something to monitor heart rate throughout the day and as something to keep track of my heart rate over time as I am a very keen cyclist. For all you fitness types out there this product isn't the best thing ever for tracking your heart rate during exercise. My chest strap heart rate monitor is far more accurate and reliable. That said it's a brilliant price of kit for heart rate throughout the day and tracking your sleep. It confirms everything I knew anyway but puts it into writing and keeps me a bit more disciplined with regards to rest and recovery. This is a brilliant purchase as long as you are aware of the downsides.
customer_reviews.author: Rar89

customer_reviews.title: Work fine for a couple of months  - Unhappy with customer service
customer_reviews.text: This item worked perfectly for a couple of months but then the screen would no longer activate all the time even when fully charged. The watch would buzz when you press the button but screen remains black - happened for a few hours at a time at first but now has been inactive for over 24 hours. I was hoping I would receive a New replacement for the item but I have to send it off in the midst of a pandemic to see if they can fix a faulty item. Not the best customer service & I will be without a watch for possible weeks. Unhappy customer
customer_reviews.author: Jake Taylor Creasey

customer_reviews.title: Good fitness watch mostly
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this watch for nearly a year and it's good for tracking steps, sleep and fitness. The only annoying thing is that every now and then the watch freezes and you have to reset it using the charger cable and plug. The mobile app can lose connection to the watch too and it takes a lot of refreshing and switching the Bluetooth on and off before it registers the stats. But all in all its a good fitness watch
customer_reviews.author: Evie Katerina

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Had my Fitbit in lilac for around 3 weeks now and I love it! Keeps me on the move, and you even win awards for reaching step milestones and challenges which you can take part with friends on the app (You need to download the app and add device which is so easy to do!). Also tracks my sleep, doesn’t seem to always work so lost a star there. Love how it syncs with Fitness Pal app. Also receive texts, WhatsApp messages and emails (Can also be set for calls and FB messenger). Very handy if don’t want or can’t have phone on me, keeps tracking as long wearing my watch. Overall highlight recommend. Wish I’d gotten one sooner!
customer_reviews.author: PinkyLilac

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from Charge 2
customer_reviews.text: Moved to this Fitbit from previously owning a charge 2. The smaller size and the waterproof drew me to this. Initially I wasn't sure on the design but I think it has grown on me. Would have preffered to have the burgundy (red wine) but as I wanted the HR version this wasn't possible. The UI on the device is taking a bit of getting used to but I think I am there. It does seem to have connectivity issues with bluetooth when I am trying to track a run/walk but I have a feeling that might be down to my phone!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Looks best...product not tested at gym yet. Failed very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: First day. Bit of a muddle pairing with my Samsung A80 as the device name and download didn't match. Had to use a different device name. Will see how it goes at the gym tomorrow. Has stopped working with my phone and Kindle Fire since 24 May. Sending it for repair. Not impressed with it. Sent for repair. Returned. Doesn't work. Unable to return item for refund as the site doesn't offer a refund option, because the status shows as being in for repair. Very disappointed as I am a very loyal customer. Customer services doesn't work. HELP!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Portlander

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable than the older model
customer_reviews.text: This model is much more comfortable to wear than my previous Fitbit. I tend not to wear it at night always as I do find I’m aware of it on my wrist then, but it doesn’t give the same ‘burn’ feeling on my skin as the older model. Slimmer design fits my slim wrist. Seems fairly accurate for step count. App doesn’t easily allow ‘treadmill’ tracking but it can be altered in the settings to log static workouts after the session. I can get tachy episodes and find the HR monitor handy to keep track of that.
customer_reviews.author: SmartUK

customer_reviews.title: Better than Apple
customer_reviews.text: Having previously had an Apple watch, I wasn't expecting much from fitbit. I was very wrong, it is great does exactly what I need/want it to and as a bonus you can wear it loose like a bangle rather that snug around your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: La la

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do Heart Rate!
customer_reviews.text: Feeling pretty cheesed off. I assumed that all fitbits did Heart Rate (having purchased several already). This was a replacement for one for my wife. Only after breaking the seal and wearing it for a while did we realise that it doesn't do heart rate. Also, couldn't work out (or it doesn't do?) additional exercise monitoring e.g. yoga. So, now this one gets thrown in a drawer and I have to buy the HR version. Beware! Don't make the same mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this brand, but have found it a disappointment. It often doesn’t sync properly; the figures on the device and app often differ. One of the “support” people suggested deleting then reinstalling the app, and this did work, but who wants to do this every time the sync doesn’t work? You also can’t change settings on the device, you have to use the app. And would it REALLY be so hard to have a colour display? I got this at a discount price but I would not have been happy paying full price (£80+) for what is essentially a basic product.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenlady

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit devices are plagued with compatibility issues. Sometimes they sync to your device via the app, sometimes they don’t. Unless you enjoy spending hours working through solutions to save your activities and to get the time right on your Fitbit device then avoid Fitbits and go with a reputable brand of tracker. I bought a Fitbit inspire hr and it struggles to connect to a Samsung tablet and moto g8 phone, both running up to date android os. Terrible device, frustrating user experience.
customer_reviews.author: Suedehead

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product for a few months now and really like it. I previously bought a cheaper branded fitness watch but found it bulky and quite basic! Great as a starter but I was ready to take the Fitbit plunge! I’m glad I did, I really like the sleek style of the inspire and have had no problems with the watch or the app! It’s really easy to use, charge and I love the automatic walk and sleep logging, no need to remember to set anymore! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Funeral Coming Soon
customer_reviews.text: Stopped tracking sleep after a month. This is the 2nd fitbit I've had that's died prematurely but my wife has gone through 6. Fitbit won't refund your purchase, but they'll swap the watch or discount your next purchase. I don't want to be offered the next worse thing they've come up with, I'd be just happy for a refund or the tech to last at least 12 months. I don't know how Fitbit is still trading, just check out their own community forums. No one's happy and trust pilot is even worse. I can't even be arsed sending it back. Good luck Fitbit. I'm looking forward to your funeral x
customer_reviews.author: Dean Slack

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but takes ages to sync with the app
customer_reviews.text: It's a great device, and does everything it says on the tin accurately in my experience. App is easy to use and provides lots of data for the different categories it offers (heart rate/sleep/steps etc). NEGATIVE: The only negative for me is that it takes ages for mine to sync with the app on my phone. I have to keep my thumb on my screen for 5-10mins to get it to complete the sync (if my phone locks is stops the sync). I'm using a P20 phone so it shouldn't really have this problem. Not sure if other users have this issue though...
customer_reviews.author: Jacko

customer_reviews.title: lasted 4 month
customer_reviews.text: Beginning was fine, neat device and once you got how to change the band all was good, but after 2 month the screen went black, after consulting website, had to restart device, which worked, 2 weeks later the sleep-tracking became very patchy, again a reset, now the heart rate tracking is not working, factory reset,wiping all data, nothing working, It is a sleek device but it is not working, also the "writ-flick" wake-up did not work anymore, so of no use
customer_reviews.author: Starlight

customer_reviews.title: Very good, could be better
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a Fitbit for ages, I am very impressed and really enjoy wearing it, I also think it's a good price, the battery life is a bit short, have to charge every couple of days also why is the charging lead 2 inches long? I have to literally dangle it from my plug socket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great app, but watch sometimes hangs/stops responding to touch
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the missus to use after her previous Fitbit Charge HR broke and fell apart. This one also has HR tracker, and for most part tracks everything it should correctly/accurately. The only niggle is that once every month or so the watch would freeze/get stuck and not respond until it is hard reset (google this - seems to be a common problem with this particular fitness tracker - plug it in as if charging, then hold on to the physical button for about 20 seconds).
customer_reviews.author: Derek Y.

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: Wife talked me into this and it's been like a kick up the backside. Helps with a calorie control diet, motivated me to get up and about, plus has shown me how appalling my sleep actually is, prompting me to sort it out. I can honestly say this is one of the best items I have bought due to the ease of use, and impact its had on my motivation. Scanning barcodes with the app for some foods too for nutritional info, challenging you to walk a bit more, competing with others.
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other step tracker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Alta not realising that it did not track heart rate; without this feature the sleep tracking is not possible. I have found the accuracy way out, my husband and I take the same walk and he is usually hundreds if not thousands of steps ahead of me despite setting my stride length. Also in comparison to other health apps it can be about 2 km short over a 7-8 km walk. Both my husband and I find syncing difficult. Often it takes several attempts over about 1⁄2 hour to complete. I do regret spending money on this as I don’t feel it is as good as other trackers.
customer_reviews.author: VGM

customer_reviews.title: Not a particularly useful watch
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this about six months and, never having had a fitness tracker before have nothing to compare it with. As far as that is concerned it has made me more aware of exercise taken/not taken and my sleep patterns. As a watch it is not so useful. I can’t simply glance at my wrist to see the time, but have to press a button- difficult when cycling; the display is invisible outside in the summer; most irritatingly, when using the exercise tracker, there seems to be no way of displaying the time - again a nuisance when cycling.
customer_reviews.author: trouvay

customer_reviews.title: An excellent step up from a Fitbit Alta
customer_reviews.text: Much more comprehensive information provided by this device than by the Fitbit Alta that I had before. The sleep breakdown seems particularly good, although I find that maybe once or twice a week it misses the first two or three hours of my sleep - giving me a much shorter 'night' than I have actually had ! This might be due to the way I toss and turn while settling down to sleep, as I use a CPAP machine at night. I have not yet tried the Inspire HR while swimming, but hope to find it as waterproof and informative as it suggests . . .
customer_reviews.author: Bunyip

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 days
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this for a refund/placement. It set up & worked ok for 5 and half days. The wrist turn stopped working and the tap screen to activate stopped too. The same day it lost connection & would not bluetooth pair. I have followed all the advice on the fitbit help, but no matter what I do it will not pair up again. The problem cannot be my phone as all my other devices are pairing & working fine. Thus is my 3rd fitbit in 4 years & they should be more reliable than this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaynie

customer_reviews.title: No Bluetooth connection as Inspire. Setup as InspireHR. Stay away from Fitbit.
customer_reviews.text: What a load of rubbish. The product team have a lot to respond to with this shockingly poor design. It has taken me 4 hours of research and being number 61 in the queue on Fitbit chat before I came across someone who had the same problem. After multiple updates to three devices to see if it was my issue or fit bit I found out from someone else’s post if you set it up as Inspire HR it will connect with Bluetooth. If I have one more issue in the next month this product will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: MacAsia

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonable fitness watch and does what it says. Pity it doesn't give a heart rate - or if it does, I've not found it yet! Otherwise, it does what it says and keeps me aware of how much or how little I am walking during the day and how well or badly I am sleeping at night. Which is exactly what I wanted it for! Battery life is good also.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good value with £20 off RRP
customer_reviews.text: I bought a black strap FITBIT Inspire HR on special offer. I immediately replaced the black strap as I can't bear FITBIT's rubber straps. The Inspire HR is not as good as my Alta HR, (which has stopped working after getting wet, and I was gutted to learn it had been discontinued). Having said that, it's ok. It tells the time and measures steps and heart rate, but I really dislike the cheap plastic press button on the side. It's quite light, even though I have put a metal strap on it. I wouldn't have paid full price, but I was happy enough with the discount.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I charged it put it on and said I had burnt 650 cals! So was it guessing?? I went out for 90 mins I’d done 1400 steps!! I’d hardly moved! So inaccurate I’d be better guessing myself so returned after one day I gave the 2 stars for how it looks , but I thought even the app was annoying ! Couldn’t do much and didn’t find easy to navigate even thou there wasn't much on it to go through
customer_reviews.author: Babynet

customer_reviews.title: Display difficult to impossible to read in daylight especially if sunny
customer_reviews.text: Functionality good. Its just that you cannot read the display outside in daylight, even if its not sunny, but even worse if it is. As the purpose of buying was to track heartbeats,steps etc whilst hiking, it does not really reach expectations. Sync to the app is good, data viewed there helpful, but live data problematic due to poor dial visibility. I saw a fellow hiker had one, and she was struggling to read it too.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Motivational!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to motivate me to move more and it does. But it doesn't keep a proper record of sleep times. Today it says I was restless 5X during sleep - they are probably the times I woke up and tossed and turned to get back to sleep. When I cut the grass it recorded it as exercise, I work in the garden, weeding, digging, trimming hedges it doesn't record it. Makes me drink more water tho' and I do move more trying to keep my steps up and beat yesterdays total! I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Scaife

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but not 100% accurate and not too easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: The app works well and combined a number of fitness app functions into the one app. However, I've found that the app isn't that accurate when calculating calories burnt and isn't always as accurate with counting steps as you'd might like it to be. Also found that it took several hours to ensure the watch was fully up to date in order to ensure it was ready to use properly. Other than that, would probably recommend, but if asked to choose between this watch and another, more accurate, more easy to use one, I'd probably choose the other one.
customer_reviews.author: A1tam0nt

customer_reviews.title: Product breaks down after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product replaced twice, so three Fitbits in total, and all three have failed. After two months of use they begin to break down, the screen stops detecting swipes and the button stops working completely. Restarting the device as recommended does nothing to fix these issues and the device eventually turns off for good. It's a shame as the various tracking features are very good! Personally it has put me off all Fitbit models, but in general I'd avoid this model if planning on buying a Fitbit device
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable value fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Brought the Fitbit to wear as felt I was missing out if I didn't have my phone on me doing any activity. The synchronising with the app causes me to mark both the device and application down. Takes ages for the app to find the Fitbit when centimetres from the phone. Like the sleep tracking. Battery life seems good. Disappointed that it's not compatible with Samsung Health App. Get widely differing step counts from Fitbit and Samsung Health even if I have both with me over same period.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: So inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Well, apparently a drive in my car for 20 minutes is seen by the Fitbit as an outdoor bike ride and and I can burn 90 calories by just lying down in bed for 15 minutes whilst 35 minutes of vigorous swimming is 120 calories! So much for accuracy! Not impressed! Week 2: Swimming is now been recorded as running, it still reads driving as an outdoor bike ride and walking around at work is apparently a sport? I chose Fitbit because I thought it would be a guarantee of quality. This watch is so inaccurate is beyond a joke! I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Bottani

customer_reviews.title: Not Enuf Info.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fitbit for many years until it died. It was perfectly compatible with my Microsoft PC and then my MAC. This one had no information about which machines it might not work with and so I excitedly bought it expecting no problems. Well, it's not compatible and Fitbit would be helpful if they made that clear in their sales pitch. I tried to download various connect apps but bottom line, it's not workable. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Siouxie

customer_reviews.title: Slept monitoring great
customer_reviews.text: All in all its a perfect device if your not obsessed with accuracy, I'd say 80% accurate. Sleep graphs can be a bit ambiguous, I move around a lot in my sleep and it records this as awake time - maybe it's true! But on the whole, I've got pretty much same sleep pattern as rest of population, which is surprising. I'm a bit obsessed with quality of sleep as it impacts on EVERY aspects of our lives. Would highly recommend. Just remember to keep the heart monitor switched on, or you won't get a sleep map!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Collette Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loving my Fitbit inspire.
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely loving it. I'm more encouraged to exercise and get in a minimum of 10.000 steps now it records it for me I've tried to with my phone but it's not accurate. Live the colour and if I do die to add different straps they are easy to swap over if only all straps were like these would make things so much easier. Not too expensive on a budget theres plenty of choice and I think I made the right one with this especially if your new to fitbit it's really simple and easy to use especially with the app to let you know exactly what everything means.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 weeks and it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: TheFitBit Inspire HR arrived and looked good, well packaged. Easy to set up and fun to check steps, swimming and sleep. Wore it for a week and it's stopped working. Have been onto the seller and still waiting for action to address this problem. While it worked it was great but......!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and useful
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to spend money on a fitbit incase it wasn't as good as people say or o got bored but honestly I love it. I do Lot of walking and enjoy tracking my sleep also. The reminders definitely encourage me to move more. Hardly notice it on my wrist either which is annoying thing which put me off. I have loosened it quite a bit in the hot weather and it still records well.
customer_reviews.author: VioletMoon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bit of kit!
customer_reviews.text: Primarily bought to monitor my sleep pattern which is excellent - it's even helped me change my sleep pattern and it's improving all the time. It's excellent for monitoring heart rate, fitness levels, nutrition etc. I'm sure it can be used for more, I'm just using it for basic stuff and I love it. I'm not techy and managed to set it up (though initially was having reminders to go to bed at mid day!) on my phone and tablet. Definitely worth the money in my view.
customer_reviews.author: Di Fairbank

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well so far. Sleep tracker seems fairly accurate even when I have a afternoon nap :) it’s comfy to wear and notifications come through really well. Exercises in the gym seem to be quite accurate aswell which is really useful. I charged it fully first day I received it (on Wednesday) and it is supposed to have 5 days battery life but I have just had to recharge it this evening(Friday) as it reached low battery. I do have a habit of constantly looking at my wrist so I must of drained the battery. Over all, very handy good fitness watch.
customer_reviews.author: Storme92

customer_reviews.title: GPS issue
customer_reviews.text: Overall I liked this product. Looks nice and (most) features work as they should. I really enjoyed the sleep tracking in particular (useful to have the HR feature for this, which the other Inspire does not have). The big problem is GPS tracking for cycling. Oddly enough, GPS works fine for running and walking, but not cycling. This seems to be a common issue with this device (I've seen lots of other comments about this flaw online). Because of that I've had to return the item. If you want this device specifically for tracking cycling, I would advise you look at alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Bruna Costa

customer_reviews.title: Does its job decently
customer_reviews.text: I have super small wrists (13') so I was worried it might not fit me but I was wrong! It wraps very snuggly around my wrist and I'm only on the 4th hole on the strap, so it would certainly fit wrists that are even smaller than mine. The sleep and heartrate feature are very interesting. Connects to my phone for GPS to track my walking, which is fine for me because I have my phone with me all the time anyways. It sometimes disconnects when I'm indoors tho which I don't know why, but it didn't affect the overall tracking I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Ho

customer_reviews.title: Great for new to fitness
customer_reviews.text: I love it I really do but I do question the accuracy sometimes. I do love getting my messages to my wrist as a handy way to check them before going thought the phone. And I like the reminders j can set up throughout the day to get me moving or drinking. It's been a great little start up for my fitness journey and I will probably invest in another higher model when I am more active.
customer_reviews.author: Sinead09

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit great product
customer_reviews.text: I like this item as I can check the results on my iPhone. See how much sleep and how many steps done in a day. I have had cheaper similar things in the past but this is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Annieroonie

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: This is brilliant, ive always wanted a 'smart watch' but never really knew what to go for as I wasn't sure what id use. This is affordable, tracks everything that I want to and really does encourage you to get up and move. I've done more steps since having this than I used to, which is great! I love the community tab on the app and how it allows you to set up competitions with family and friends which also really encourages you to get moving. Though I wish that it was a little cheaper 😋
customer_reviews.author: Sarahjane

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes takes a wee while to sync and I find the battery doesn’t last as long as I would like Often difficult to read screen outside in the daylight. I’ve got the maroon coloured one so that may be the issue Overall though I am happy with purchase as my previous Fitbit had no screen so I needed to wear a watch as well, this is much better! Also didn’t want the heart rate version so this suits me well
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Totally inaccurate, absolutely no use.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of money. Does not track anything correctly. I was sitting at my desk typing and it counted that as a 15min aerobic workout. My motorbike commute to work was counted as 2000 steps. The Fitbit forum is full of people complaining about how inaccurate it is and nothing is being done to fix it. I got this on Friday, Monday morning it's getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Great model, seamless interaction with App
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant for my sons needs. He’s active and also likes to swim hence buying this model as opposed to the kids version. App works brilliantly, motivated my son to be more active and it’s very comfortable to wear. The charger lead is very short which means it needs to be charged in a worktop or on the door near plug socket which is annoying but above all else it’s a perfect gift for those who like to track their movements
customer_reviews.author: CrisG

customer_reviews.title: Good value for your money
customer_reviews.text: Speedy delivery , well packaged . Sadly it does not have a have heart rate monitor . So does not track your sleep pattern. Having said that you can press sleep now ,then press I'm awake. It does say how much sleep you have . One thing it does not have is to monitor how many floors you do in a day as you get virtual badges for the equivalent of how many floors you have gone up according to how many steps you have taken
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Tanya M. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Everything is more accurate on the HR model. Might have bought the HR model had I known this.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this primarily for sleep tracking which didn’t work at all in the first instance and I considered returning the Fitbit and started a returns process. However, the Fitbit support line talked me through changing the settings to ‘sensitive mode’ and I am now really happy with my Fitbit. Not 100% accurate on sleep or kilometres walked but very happy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puchase from Fitbit. Ensure  that your smartphone is compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I have a heart condition and I purchased this on 24 August due to the heart rate monitor feature. The device stopped working and after contacting Fitbit it was reset on 21 September. It worked fine until 12 November when it started shoeing the time and date. I contacted Fitbit and after trying to get it working again and failing, they sent me a replacement. I could not get the replacement work and contacted Fitbit. After spending almost half an hour on the phone without solving the problem, I was told that the Inspire HR is not compatible with my Samsung Galaxy A5 phone. No refund as not purchased from Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr R Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: If dont want the HR monitor I'd buy a cheaper version.
customer_reviews.text: This fitbit was bought to give me insight and help me get more active, which it dose. The HR is good to monitor sleep but the down side is the display on the touch screen wont stay on long enough to scroll through the display so dont use it much. I keep it as a watch and use the mobile app to monitor my scores So it's rather an expensive bit of kit that's doesn't work as it should. I think some of the cheaper ones work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: J L Berry

customer_reviews.title: Good value and accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I had burned through a few cheap health trackers and felt it was time to buy a more durable one. This Fitbit is accurate and has a good battery. The only downside is the software. It's ok once you are used to it but it's not very intuitive and the synchronisation can often take too long. I sometimes have to restart my phone a few times. Other than that issue it's very good and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Iconochasm

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt workand the support is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I am so annoyed I have had this 3 days and after the second day the hourly reminders became erratic and stopped while the sleep tracker logs my wake up time as the time I click on the phone app to sync it. I have called the amazon product support line 4 times to be talked over, not listened to and shouted at by one staff peraon who then hung up the phone.
customer_reviews.author: lia

customer_reviews.title: Sleep tracking and step count great
customer_reviews.text: Bought to aid in recovery after ACL/MCL injury meaning I was unable to walk for a while. When I was able to move again I wanted to track steps and try to up them - this did the job perfectly. The sleep tracking is fantastic, also really like the silent alarms (my partner works shifts so doesn’t disturb him which is great). Also, found it reasonably priced for a FitBit product too. Really easy to change the straps which can make it a smarter looking watch too.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate and definitely not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter but was disappointed. It looks like the picture, but it calculates calories burned when you’re not even wearing it and if you just shake your arm up and down it calculates you’ve taken steps! Not accurate and would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: munchkin71

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to buy the Fitbit as it is my first. However for the price I’m a bit disappointed. It’s records every movement as steps even when I’m just moving my arms. And the sleep tracker is not that accurate either. The battery life on the other hand is very good. I installed the app on my phone so I’m able to record and monitor steps, exercise, water intake and other stuff. Would I buy another fit bit in the future? Not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Phemmy

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous fit bit wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Brought in Black Friday deals started going wrong in feb .Numerous emails to fitbit back and forth (it was in lockdown) wouldn’t sync freezing black screen eventually replaced by fit bit end of march .By june same problems with replacement this time i rang them and got another replacement immediately!! Thankful for fit bits customer service but really dissatisfied with the product !!!
customer_reviews.author: noonoo97

customer_reviews.title: Won't sync, awful customer service
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well for a week, then stopped syncing. I followed all the advice online, then contacted customer service, who told me to connect it to another device. I don't have another device to connect it to. I was then told that there is a problem with the Inspire HR and my phone's OS, but they'd email me when it was fixed. It worked fine for a week, so I don't quite believe that, and regardless, having spent £85 on a watch I'd like it to work NOW, not when they get round to fixing it. Absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs F  M Reid-Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Misbehaved at first but perfect now
customer_reviews.text: I find that this is very sensitive and was counting more steps than I took so I inputted that I was wearing it in my dominant arm even though I’m not and it seems to be perfect. It behaved a little bit funny for the first few days but has been working just fine over the last few weeks. Would definitely recommend especially if you can get the 3 months 0% to pay for it
customer_reviews.author: Jools

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase of a fitbit and very disappointed with this one
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller than my last and I bought another strap to use which didn't work at all. The whole experience of this particular model was not good and I am not wearing it anymore as it was difficult to see, got stuck between swipes, cut out when you touched it and was troublesome all the time. I miss having a fitbit on my wrist but this one was nothing but issue after issue and I got tired of trying to make it work. Thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Ella prime

product_meta.title: Fitbit Inspire Fitness Tracker, One Size (S and L Bands Included)
product_meta.description: Color:Black (Non-Heart Rate)Fitbit inspire is a friendly fitness tracker for every day that helps you build healthy habits. This encouraging companion motivates you to reach your weight and fitness goals and even enjoy the journey with calorie burn tracking, goal celebrations, sleep tracking and guidance, reminders to move and up to 5 days of battery life. Large fits wrist 7.1"" 8.7"" in circumference. Small fits wrist 5.5"" 7.1"".
feature_bullets: Track all day activity, including steps, distance, hourly activity, active minutes and calories burned
Automatically track your sleep & set silent alarms that wake you by buzzing on your wrist
Enjoy up to 5 days of battery for daily progress without constant charging. Varies with use & other factors
Automatically and conveniently record workouts like walks, swimming & bike rides with smart track
The on screen dashboard, intuitive touchscreen & backlit display makes the inspire tracker easy to use & love
Acknowledge milestones on your journey with on screen celebrations when you hit your activity goals

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
